pullRequest.title: Refactor RestUtils.setUserMetadataHeaders to take byte array or map as input

commit.message: Refactor RestUtils.setUserMetadataHeaders to accept byte array or map
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:linkedin/ambry into usermetadata-headers-map

nodes.bodyText:
There seems to be a difference between the map provided in open source and the closed source place where this is intended to be used.
RestUtils.buildUserMetadata returns a map with keys that already have the "x-ambry-um-" prefix.
The decoded map in closed source does not (without writing some code that adds them).
Would it be possible to make buildUserMetadata not prepend the prefix and have setUserMetadataHeaders do it instead?
Agree. Also I am trying to understand the motivation to have this new method. Are you planning to replace the piece of similar logic after codec.decode in closed source to avoid duplicate code?

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' of github.com:linkedin/ambry into usermetadata-headers-map
